definition: to pull open/to pull apart/to space out/to increase
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
(fig.) to raise the curtain/to lift the curtain/to be a curtain raiser for
to assume a fighting stance/(fig.) to take the offensive

sentences.english: Megeve ski station started its season early thanks to the recent snowfalls.
sentences.chinese: 最近的降雪已拉開了梅傑夫滑雪站的賽季。

sentences.english: As I arrived at the bus stop the driver opened his big manual hinged door.
sentences.chinese: 等我到了巴士站，司機用手拉開那道大鉸鏈門。

sentences.english: Chris unhooked the shutters and went out on the balcony .
sentences.chinese: 克里斯拉開百葉窗，走到了陽臺上。

sentences.english: He stood up and drew the curtains to let in the pale glint of dawn.
sentences.chinese: 他起身拉開窗簾，讓黎明的翕光射進房間。

sentences.english: They unrolled the cloth onto the table.
sentences.chinese: 他們在桌上把布匹拉開。

sentences.english: The talent show in the evening drew the curtain with guitar playing.
sentences.chinese: 晚間的才藝表演在吉它的彈唱中拉開序幕。

sentences.english: The curtains opened to reveal a darkened stage.
sentences.chinese: 帷幕拉開，顯出暗沉沉的舞臺。

sentences.english: Lift the paper support, and extend the paper exit tray.
sentences.chinese: 打開紙張支架並拉開出紙托盤。

sentences.english: She drew the curtains and let the sunshine into the room.
sentences.chinese: 她把窗簾拉開，讓陽光照進室內。

sentences.english: Is the action of nature not unlike drawing a bow?
sentences.chinese: 自然的法則，豈不象弓拉開了弦一樣嗎？

sentences.english: The 47th Paris International Air Show has kicked off at Bourget, a Paris suburb.
sentences.chinese: 第47屆巴黎國際航展在巴黎市郊布爾熱拉開帷幕。

sentences.english: Secondly, professional class also is to increase a mark, pull open the key of class.
sentences.chinese: 其二，專業課也是提高分數，拉開檔次的關鍵。

sentences.english: 16A bolt drawn back and Walter welcomes me.
sentences.chinese: 16門栓拉開了，沃爾特把我讓進去。

sentences.english: At times, some people decide to just unzip and let loose on the front of a building.
sentences.chinese: 有時候，有些人決定就在建築物前拉開拉鍊解決問題。

sentences.english: Just unzip and fold down the cover.
sentences.chinese: 拉開拉鍊並且折迭蓋子。

sentences.english: Lucy pushes Kim, and the officer breaks up the tussle.
sentences.chinese: 露西推倒了金姆，警員拉開打架的各方。

definition: to open/to show (a ticket)/to turn on/to switch on
to unfold/to carry out/to be in full swing/to launch
on the eve of/to be about to/to be on the verge of
to leave/to bid farewell to/to say good-bye to
